intro: Cyathea minima, commonly known as the dwarf tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact stature, typically reaching only a few meters in height. The plant features a stout, fibrous rootstock and a single trunk that is covered with a thick layer of persistent, dark brown to blackish scales. Its fronds are pinnate, with a smooth, glossy surface and a dark green color. Cyathea minima thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
